replies.author: bipinprasad

replies.bodyText: Seems there is a slight problem. In python code, when exec_java_class() is called, the arguments to the java class is constructed partly from main_class_args. main_class_args is constructed by simply eliminating some arguments passed to the python code (and keeping the rest intact). So if python code got passed "-e" ii will get passed thru to java class as "-e". However, if "--exception was passed to python, then --exception will get passed to java. This wont match what java class is expecting. So in order to do a passthru, the option names should be the same, otherwise main_class_args should be suitably modified based on the args. Looks like passthru might be preferred solution.
replies.author: bipinprasad

replies.bodyText: Yea, the argument in python is the same: "--exception-when-empty".
